section.title: Compiler Enumeration
section.para: The compiler enumeration describes the primary actions of the compiler, including most of the optimizations and features, taking the nested AST representation into a linear format suitable for compiling from the back end of the compiler. Pay attention to the way in which stimuli are ordered. Particularly, certain things, like binding, appear infix, while others, like expressions, are postfix in presentation. Still others take a start/end pattern. Some of the trickery here hides beneath the abstraction of the stimuli, but there is still a bit of it at the surface that one should consider when examining these tables.

listitem.para: Bindings appear in prefix order, the binding node first followed by the value to be assigned and then the thing to assign, if necessary.
Function, Strand, and Operator applications appear in postfix order, listing the right argument first and then the left argument next in the sequence before the function, operator, or strand node.
Condition and Guard nodes appear infix
